sections.title: Essential Insurance Types
sections.content: Core insurance needs include health, auto, homeowners/renters, life, and disability insurance. Each serves a different purpose: health covers medical costs, auto protects against vehicle damage, homeowners protects your property, life replaces income for dependents, and disability replaces income if you can't work.

points.title: Risk Assessment
points.description: Evaluate potential financial losses from death, disability, illness, property damage, or liability claims.

points.title: Coverage Amounts
points.description: Life insurance should replace 10-15x annual income; disability should cover 60-80% of income for 2-5 years.

points.title: Deductibles and Premiums
points.description: Higher deductibles lower premiums but increase out-of-pocket costs for claims.

sections.title: Insurance is Risk Transfer
sections.content: Insurance transfers financial risk from you to the insurance company. Don't self-insure against catastrophic losses that could derail your financial plan.

sections.title: Shopping for Insurance
sections.content: Compare quotes from multiple providers, understand policy details and exclusions, and consider working with an independent insurance agent. Look for financially strong companies and read reviews of their claims process. Bundle policies where possible for discounts.

sections.title: Review Your Insurance Coverage
steps: List all current insurance policies and their coverage amounts
Identify gaps in coverage based on your current life situation
Get quotes from 2-3 providers for any needed coverage
Update beneficiaries and ensure policies align with your overall financial plan

sections.title: Annual Insurance Review
sections.content: Set a calendar reminder to review all insurance policies annually. Life changes like marriage, home purchase, or having children often require coverage adjustments.
